course_main_structural_unit.address:
Narva mnt 18
51009 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: In the part of probability theory the  random events and properties of classical probability are considered. The course covers the theory of random variables and their distributions as well. In the part of mathematical statitics the course covers basics of the statistical inference. First, a point estimator, its properties and methods for finding it are considered. Also the interval estimation and testing of statistical hypotheses are treated.
description.et: Tõenäosusteooria osas tutvutakse tõenäosusteooria meetoditega ja õpitakse tundma klassikalisi tõenäosusjaotusi. Matemaatilise statistika osa käsitleb statistilise hindamisülesande aluseid. Vaadeldakse punkthinnangut, hinnangu leidmise meetodeid ja omadusi. Seejärel vaadeldakse vahemikhinnangut ja statistiliste hüpoteeside kontrolli.

objectives.en: To give knowledge and experience in probability and statistics, which enables to attend higher level courses on stochastic modelling in master studies.
objectives.et: Anda üliõpilastele teadmised ja oskused tõenäosusteoorias ja matemaatilises statistikas, mis võimaldavad magistriõppes läbida kõrgema taseme kursusi stohhastilise modelleerimise alal.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing the course a student
· knows design of modern probability theory;
· knows the concept of random variables and some most common probability distributions and is able to compute various numerical parameters related to both discrete and continuous random variables;
learning_outcomes.et: · tunneb juhusliku suuruse mõistet ja klassikalisi tõenäosusjaotusi ning oskab leida juhuslike suuruste arvkarakteristikuid nii diskreetsete kui ka pidevate juhuslike suuruste korral;

learning_outcomes.en: · knows basic methods of estimation and testing theory;
learning_outcomes.et: · tunneb hindamis- ja testimisteooria põhilisi meetodeid;

learning_outcomes.en: · understands the entity of the estimate and are able to characterize it by the corresponding properties (unbiasness, efficiency, consistency);
learning_outcomes.et: · mõistab punktihinnangu olemust ja oskab iseloomustada seda vastavate omaduste abil (nihketus, efektiivsus, mõjusus);

learning_outcomes.en: · knows the basic methods for  deriving estimates and are able to apply them (the maximum likelihood, least-squares methods and the method of moments);
learning_outcomes.et: · teab põhimeetodeid hinnangute leidmiseks ja oskab neid rakendada (suurima tõepära, vähimruutude ja momentide meetodid);

learning_outcomes.en: · understand the entity of the hypothesis and are able to construct them in different situations;
learning_outcomes.et: · mõistab statistilise hüpoteesi olemust ja oskab selle sõnastada lähtuvalt ülesandest;

learning_outcomes.en: · is able to construct interval estimates and handle non-normal data;
learning_outcomes.et: on võimeline konstrueerima vahemikhinnanguid ja töötama mitte-normaaljaotusega andmetega;

learning_outcomes.en: · has received training in mathematical statistics that is appropriate for studying different econometric methods.
learning_outcomes.et: · on saanud vajaliku matemaatilise statistika alase ettevalmistuse erinevate ökonomeetriliste meetodite omandamiseks.

independent_work.et: There will be given 5 homeworks during the course (detailed instructions will follow in the first lectures).

description.et: 1. test will be graded on a scale of 20 total points. You need to have a minimum of 10 points to pass the test.
2. test will be graded on a scale of 20 total points. You need to have a minimum of 10 points to pass the test.
Up to 2-5 points for every homework, 20 points in total.
Written exam will be graded on a scale of 40 total points. You need to have a minimum of 20 points to pass the exam.

grade_preconditions.et:
Two written tests during the term. One towards the middle, one at the end of the lectures. Each test will be graded on a scale of 20 total points. You need to have a minimum of 10 points to pass the test. 

If a student is ill (and therefore misses the test or retake), a doctor's note should be presented within a week to be eligible for another retake opportunity.

grade_evaluation.et:
If both tests and the exam have been passed, then the final grade will be calculated as follows: the points of test 1 (max 20p), test 2(max 20p), homework (max 20p), exam (max 40p) are summed together and the grades are:

A: 91-100
B: 81-90
C: 71-80
D: 61-70
E: 51-60
F: 0-50

Points from voluntary assignments (max 10p) will be added to final result.
If one test isn't passed, there's no possibility to take the exam and the final grade is F. There is an opportunity to retake a test if the first try should fail. 

There is no possibility to retake a test to improve results.

Overall there are 2 retake possibilities. If the 1st test try and retake fail, then there is a opportunity for a retake the 1st test if the 2nd test is passed on the first try.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Classical probability theory. Conditional probability.
Discrete random variables.
Continuous random variables.
Main probability distributions.
Statistical inference. Population and sample. Estimation function.
Properties of estimators.
Methods for deriving estimates (the maximum likelihood, least-squares methods and the method of moments).
Confidence interval estimates.
Confidence interval for the mean. Chi-square distribution, Student's t-distribution.
Confidence interval for the standard deviation and for difference.
Hypothesis testing: test statistic, critical region, type I error, type II error.
Hypothesis testing: power function, independent samples, paired samples.
Hypothesis testing: chi-square test, F-test, p-value method, testing with confidence intervals.
Types of data, measures of dependence
Introduction to linear regression
